page.title: 03Elsworth School
page.content: Elsworth School has about 100 pupils aged 4-11 and is a Church of England Aided School. It is a new building and is well equipped, with a playground, playing field and open air swimming pool. There is also a playgroup on site which is not part of the school. There are 4 classes who have the use of 5 classrooms and a hall. The school has its own kitchen and Cook; children may either purchase a school dinner or eat their own packed lunch. The school serves the four parishes of Elsworth, Boxworth, Conington and Knapwell, but almost a third of the children come from outside the catch- ment area. The school is used by village organisations in the evening. Children from 11-16 attend either Swavesey or Comberton Village Colleges.
